core.role: Leads AG Barr’s end-to-end supply chain strategy, ensuring production continuity, infrastructure scalability, and ESG-aligned growth across the beverage portfolio.
core.userGoalStatement: Guarantee uninterrupted production and efficient distribution while enabling growth and meeting sustainability targets.
core.coreBelief: Operational excellence and reliability are the foundations of brand growth and reputation.
core.contentImplication: Messaging must highlight proven reliability, scalability, and tangible sustainability performance — not generic logistics efficiency.

items.Description: Ensure production and logistics operations run without disruption, meeting daily throughput and service-level goals.
Plan and scale warehouse and transport capacity aligned to manufacturing expansion (Project Gold, Milton Keynes).
Deliver on AG Barr’s 2040 net-zero target, embedding Scope 3 reduction through partners and greener transport models.
Balance efficiency with resilience — optimise cost-to-serve amid inflation and labour shortages.
Leverage automation, WMS upgrades, and API integration to enhance data visibility and agility.

responsibilities.contentImplication: Content should acknowledge operational realities: production uptime, warehouse bottlenecks, cost pressure, and sustainability KPIs.

items: Supply chain optimisation and capacity planning
knowledge.contentImplication: Use informed terminology — e.g., ‘capacity assurance’, ‘phased scalability’, ‘sustainability embedded not bolted on’ — to show domain fluency.

items.Description: DHL's science-based targets and low-carbon transport directly support AG Barr's 2040 net-zero roadmap.
Real-estate and warehousing investments demonstrate capacity to scale with brand growth:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
Open-book operations and live dashboards enable control and predictability across the network:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.

connectionOpportunities.contentImplication: Demonstrate outcomes — resilience, uptime, and trust — rather than abstract capability claims.

motivations.contentImplication: Show how DHL reduces operational risk and creates future-proof capacity through investment, not cost savings alone.

items.Description: Warehousing and transport solutions that expand flexibly with acquisitions and brand demand (Boost, Funkin, Rubicon).
Reliable partner who can mitigate disruption risk and ensure compliance with new UK packaging and return regulations:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.
Evidence of measurable decarbonisation aligned with AG Barr’s ESG targets:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.

needs.contentImplication: Anchor messages in quantifiable business outcomes — uptime, efficiency, CO₂ reduction, service levels.

items.Description: Culina’s embedded position until 2027 creates perceived switching risk:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.
Concerns around real-estate buy/leaseback models and capital exposure:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

perceptionGaps.contentImplication: Address credibility and de-risking explicitly: show partnership investment and pay-as-you-grow flexibility.

items: Fragmented logistics network limiting visibility and control
Pressure from manufacturing to resolve space constraints quickly
Reliance on partners who prioritise cost over long-term alignment
frustrations.contentImplication: Position DHL as the partner solving these constraints with integrated, future-ready solutions.

items.Trigger: Production disruption or missed retailer SLAs
items.Messaging_Implication: Reinforce reliability and resilience — ‘Trusted to deliver’.

items.Emotional_Response: Desire for credible proof and quick wins
items.Messaging_Implication: Highlight measurable ESG progress and transparency.

emotionalTriggers.contentImplication: Use reassurance and evidence-based storytelling — metrics, case studies, and proof points.

engagementApproach.description: A pragmatic, operations-first leader focused on measurable results. Prefers concise, data-led engagement demonstrating reliability, ROI, and sustainability outcomes.

items: Fact-driven and sceptical of marketing language
Looks for peers’ validation and proof of performance
behaviors.contentImplication: Lead with credible data, operational benchmarks, and site-ready examples rather than brand narrative.

items: Prefers clear governance and escalation routes
Engages well with technical specialists and operations leaders
collaborationInsights.contentImplication: Engage through solution engineers and sustainability leads, not just account managers.

problemSolvingMethod.description: Analytical and scenario-based; balances production and commercial priorities.
problemSolvingMethod.value: Uses metrics and best-practice benchmarking to evaluate logistics options.

items.Description: ‘Production line heartbeat’ — the supply chain cannot skip a beat.
‘Runway for expansion’ — capacity must grow ahead of demand.

analogies.contentImplication: Use operational metaphors that tie reliability and scalability to growth outcomes.

messagingAngles.description: Emphasise performance, partnership, and progress — not promises.

items.Description: Demonstrate reliability metrics, uptime rates, and SLA adherence.
Show how DHL’s real-estate and low-carbon solutions future-proof growth.
Offer visibility dashboards and open-book assurance.

messagingAngles.contentImplication: Provide evidence-based messaging with operational language — ‘service level’, ‘carbon intensity’, ‘throughput efficiency’.
